title: Mobil launches 50% post-consumer recycled plastic pails in India - PR Newswire
summary: Mobil is launching an initiative to transition to 50% Post-Consumer Recycled (PCR) plastic pails. The company's move towards PCR drives the use of recycled plastic, and helps reduce plastic waste, while enabling sustainable progress. Mobil's 50% PCR pails help customers reduce waste, convert waste to value and advance sustainability ambitions.
green_innovation: TRUE, the initiative to transition to 50% Post-Consumer Recycled (PCR) plastic pails contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing plastic waste and promoting a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE, the 50% PCR pails are a new or improved product that differs significantly from the company's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, the 50% PCR pails are a green product because they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a green process.
likely_naics_codes: ['326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing', '325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product Manufacturing', '325510 - Paint and Coating Manufacturing', '562991 - Packaging Machinery Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE, the described product innovation is not an example of greenwashing because the environmental benefits of the PCR plastic pails are substantiated and not exaggerated.
